p.s: If you are interested in selling accessories ( jewellery , bags , hats etc. ) then follow these few steps that should get you up and running .

item.s: Think of a name .

figure.rend: Start an Accessory Business Step 1 Version 2.jpg

item.s: When thinking of a brand name , it 's usually best to get a notepad ready for a list that will help you remember all the name and make the process of elimination easier .
Try to think of something that emphasises your persona or brand message .
Practice makes perfect

figure.rend: Start an Accessory Business Step 2 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Go on the Internet to try to find some accessory-making courses/classes .
This will help make your brand more original , creative and will also make your days a bit easier .
Choose your brand 's theme .

figure.rend: Start an Accessory Business Step 3 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Consider how you want to represent yourself and your brand .
If you 're a happy person , opt for light colours and fun designs .
If you 're a serious , practical person , design the whole brand to how it suits you !
This is one of the most important parts .
Get inspired .

figure.rend: Start an Accessory Business Step 4 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Before you actually start making anything or finalising your brand , go to craft fairs and look at some of the homemade jewelry they have created .
Take a note down of the properties and design features of the ones that you like so you can mix them up and add to yours when you do start making !
Make the jewelry !
If you could n't find much inspiration , go on YouTube and see how they make the jewelry in different ways to give effect .
Tell and show people .

figure.rend: Start an Accessory Business Step 6 Version 2.jpg

item.s: After making all your fabulous pieces , it 's time to spread the word and put on a jewelry party !
Get a few friends to come round , have a few drinks , mingle but most importantly , ask for feedback and try to sell the bracelets !
Obviously , you should n't have high prices as they are not part of a big brand yet , but hopefully soon will be !
Advertise your products .

figure.rend: Start an Accessory Business Step 7 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Put flyers up around town and posting business cards on bulletin boards really help improve business .
Also , setting up your own website is another really helpful way to get people to buy your jewelry and try to get ' founded ' by shops and big accessory brands .

Meet the managers .
iI the jewelry is selling , it 's time to talk to some high street store managers that could maybe give you a brand funded by that shop .
Making an appointment with a lower end fashion store is a good way to start .
Keep on trying until you finally get accepted .
Help out .

figure.rend: Start an Accessory Business Step 9 Version 2.jpg

item.s: As you went to craft fairs earlier on , do the same and sell some of your accessories there , maybe to help someone in the same position as you were !
Make multiple of the same design just in case some are more popular than others .
Have a grand opening .

figure.rend: Start an Accessory Business Step 10 Version 2.jpg

item.s: if you think you have enough money , and the accessories will do well enough , maybe it 's time to open up your own shop ! Look around town and the high street to see if there are any places to let , or set up your own stall in the middle of a shopping centre .
You could maybe think about getting a ground floor apartment close to where you live and use that as the shop , with the landlord 's permission .
Get some staff and your own shop !
As the job market is rapidly getting lower , you could help a non-working friend out by giving them a job .
Even though you have your own business , it never hurts to carry the store on and try to set up a brand in another shop .
Choose an employee of the month .
Never give up .

figure.rend: Start an Accessory Business Step 12 Version 2.jpg

item.s: If the business is n't going so well , ask your friends to recommend you and advertise more on the radio or tv .
Ask a lot of stores if they would n't mind using your designs for their store .
Do n't just use only one and keep persisting .
Only open a store if your positive the accessories are doing well .
Otherwise stick to the Internet or open a stall .
If you have a 3+ story house , why not consider using the ground floor as your store ?
It 's cheaper and it wo n't be that far to travel to .
At the jewelry parties , ask your friends to bring a few of their friends for more recommendations .
You may experience debt if you are not sure about the business levels and profits .
